## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been experiencing some wallet balance issues after staking or other activities. Do you know how I can fix them?

**AI Assistant:**
I'm here to help! To fix wallet balance issues that may arise from staking or other activities, you can perform a Rescan. To do this, add the parameter `-rescan` when starting the daemon in the CLI, or follow these steps in the GUI: click "Activate Coin", choose "Verus" from the modal and select "Native mode", select the "daemon param: rescan" option, and then click "Activate Coin". This should help resolve any balance issues you're experiencing.

**User:**
That's great, thanks! I've also heard that Verus has made some additional developments to support its blockchain upgrade. Can you tell me more about those?

**AI Assistant:**
In addition to the wallet update, Verus has made two important developments to support the improved blockchain upgrade: an Electrum server with Sapling support and Sapling-enabled pool software. These developments enable Lite Mode Sapling Z-Transactions and provide fully Sapling-compatible pool software for the community.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. What exactly does the Verus Electrum server do, and how does it support Sapling transactions?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus Electrum server is an Electrum server that has been enhanced to support Sapling transactions. It allows for Lite Mode Sapling Z-Transactions, making it possible to handle Sapling transactions seamlessly. This support has been tested and deployed on Verus' Electrum Server for use with all lite mode transactions.
How can I fix wallet balance issues that may arise from staking or other activities?

To fix wallet balance issues that may arise from staking or other activities, you can perform a Rescan. To do this, add the parameter `-rescan` when starting the daemon in the CLI, or follow these steps in the GUI: click "Activate Coin", choose "Verus" from the modal and select "Native mode", select the "daemon param: rescan" option, and then click "Activate Coin".

cutting edge as a multi-coin wallet.
Additional Fixes and Improvements
This edition of the Verus wallet also fixes a few other issues and improvements, including:
Fixed: Some non-Latin usernames cause failure to load
Fixed: Wallet balance can get out of sync with blockchain when staking
To fix any out-of-sync issues, perform a Rescan by doing the following:
For CLI
Add the parameter -rescan when starting the daemon
For GUI
When starting the GUI click “Activate Coin”, not the dropdown shortcut
Choose “Verus” from the modal and select “Native mode”
Select the “daemon param: rescan” option
Click “Activate Coin”
Further Important Developments by Verus
In addition to this important and ground-breaking update to the Wallet, Verus completed two very important developments in support of the newly improved blockchain upgrade: Electrum and Pool Software.
Sapling Enabled Electrum Server
Verus has enhanced their Electrum Server for Sapling support, making Lite Mode Sapling Z-Transactions possible. Lead developer Mike Toutonghi first noticed that his attempts at finding an Electrum server which would support the new Sapling transactions, were fruitless.
As a result, Mike coded the support into the Verus Electrum server, which has been fully tested and seamlessly activated along with the blockchain Sapling activation at VerusCoin block height 227520.
The Verus Electrum server is able to be used to successfully handle Sapling transactions for “Lite Mode” of Verus and Zcash from the latest Verus v0.4.0f wallet update. This support has been tested and is deployed on Verus’ Electrum Server for use with all lite mode transactions.
Sapling Enabled Pool Software
Being thorough and excellent are two very important qualities to which Verus holds true. Providing fully Sapling compatible pool software is another example of this commitment to the community and the project.
